name: JFile Encryptor
short_description:
JFile Encryptor gives you the ability to encrypt and decrypt any file type that may contain private or confidential information, using AES / Rijndael 128,192 and 256bits, a random salt and variable salt size (8-256 bytes), and a random IV (Initialization Vector) (16 bytes for AES) and a pass-phrase to encrypt files. Alternatively self generated AES keys can be used instead of a passphrase however, then Demi-God keys may not be used.

Files are then decrypted using either a God key (or master key which contains all information needed to decrypt a file), Demi-God key (requires the key file and a password from the user) or Ritual key (salt,iv and password are spread over a user defined number of key files).

This application requires:
- Java runtime 7+
- JCE Unlimted Strength Policy files for 192 and 256bit AES. 
Download here:  http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jce-7-download-432124.html
Installation see:  http://www.ngs.ac.uk/tools/jcepolicyfiles
summary: Encrypt & decrypt files using AES-128,192 & 256 with PBE & key files
